summary: Enzyme evolution involves gradual functional expansion through adaptive mutations, often starting from pre-existing low-level functions. Promiscuous enzymes provide potential starting points for novel functional adaptations.
key_claims: Enzyme evolution occurs gradually via adaptive mutations forming a continuous network in sequence space.
Low-level enzymatic functions and promiscuity can serve as stepping stones for new functions.
Overexpression of promiscuous enzymes can compensate for the loss of essential metabolic enzymes.
